attributes.action: Don't scrap the Gender Recognition Act reforms, and make trans rights equal.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government can make changes to the laws and acts surrounding the main issues and allow trans people to be treated equally. The disrespect that is shown towards them is completely unethical and things have to change. Regressive action should not be allowed to further marginalise trans people in society.
For more info see: https://www.stonewall.org.uk/gender-recognition-act-gra-take-action-trans-equality
Or PinkNews's (pinknews.co.uk) article dated 15th June 2020 on the matter.
attributes.background: The Government should not scrap the GRA reforms, instead they should focus on allowing trans people to have the same rights as everyone else. They should be respected and allowed to have their dignity instead of being repressed. Trans people are still people and they deserve to be treated as such.

rejection.details:
Reform the Gender Recognition Act: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327108

Uphold current legal protections for transgender individuals and under 18s:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318175

Do not ban gender transition treatments for under 18s:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318025

Add gender identity to the characteristics protected under the Equality Act 2010:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301138

Require schools and colleges to have gender neutral toilets:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302997

Introduce Gender and Race equity for GCSE English Literature set texts:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324934
